SENT.plain: Alternating hemiplegias in children suggest the possibility of a Moyamoya syndrome
In the absence of clinical symptoms it is the EEG which will offer the decisive clue in childhood Moyamoya syndrome
The pertinent finding, which consists in progressive frequency decrease and amplitude activation after hyperventilation, has only been described in pediatric patients
It has been termed re-build-up phenomenon
Magnet resonance imaging and magnet resonance angiography (MR angiography) are able to confirm the tentative diagnosis of a Moyamoya syndrome based on the EEG
